Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Ness \Ness\, n. [AS. n[ae]s, ns; akin to Icel. nes, Sw. n["a]s, Dan. n[ae]s, and E. nose. [root] 261. See {Nose}.] A promontory; a cape; a headland. --Hakluyt. [1913 Webster]
Note: Ness is frequently used as a suffix in the names of places and promontories; as, Sheerness. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: -ness \-ness\ [AS. -ness, -nyss, -nys; akin to OS. -nissi, nussi, D. -nis, OHG. -nissa, -nass[=i], -nuss[=i], G. -nis, -niss, Goth. -inasus.] A suffix used to form abstract nouns expressive of quality or state; as, goodness, greatness. [1913 Webster]
ness n : a strip of land projecting into a body of water [syn: {cape}]
